dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Oracle Takes Run at Cloud’s Big Three With Trump-Backed AI Pact
News Content: (Bloomberg) -- Oracle Corp. has charged out of the gate in 2025, after its best year in a quarter-century. A plan unveiled with President Donald Trump has intensified hopes that its cloud business will see a tailwind from artificial intelligence.

Most Read from Bloomberg

How Sanctuary Cities Are Preparing for Another Showdown With Trump Texas HOA Charged With Discrimination for Banning Section 8 Renters Donations to LA Fire Victims Rise Past $200 Million Mark LA Schools Wrecked by Fires Plead on GoFundMe for Help to Reopen NY’s Hochul Calls for Law Banning Cell Phone Use in Schools

The stock’s latest advance came on news the software company is forming a $100 billion joint venture with SoftBank Group Corp. and OpenAI to fund an expansion of data centers to support a business in which Oracle lags behind rivals like Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp.

“This certainly has us looking at the name in a way we hadn’t before, since this could represent a meaningful inflection in growth,” said Tim Ghriskey, senior portfolio strategist at Ingalls & Snyder. “It seems like it is in good company here, but my main hesitation is about how long this halo might last, since the stock has really rocketed.”

Oracle shares have performed like some of the tech giants that have driven the market’s gains for the past two years, as it seeks to establish itself as a major player in cloud computing. The stock is up more than 10% in January after posting a nearly 60% gain last year, its best performance since 1999.

The joint venture has a goal of growing to “at least” $500 billion, which would be considerable in comparison to the tens of billions of dollars that megacaps have poured into AI. UBS expects the combined capex of major tech companies will come in at $280 billion in 2025.

However, there are questions about the scope of new commitments and whether the news represents a dramatic increase from previously announced plans. Elon Musk publicly questioned whether the companies could follow through on their promises, while Anthropic’s CEO also queried the financing and said the project seemed “a bit chaotic.”

In a sign of the headline whiplash that has accompanied his return to the presidency, Trump also said he would be open to Oracle Chairman Larry Ellison buying TikTok as part of a joint venture with the US government, a prospect that is difficult to measure in terms of its likelihood or impact.

“This is all very speculative, and potentially meaningful, but it sounds crazy to me in a lot of ways,” Ghriskey said. “It is good to be on Trump’s good side, but that can be a short-term thing.”

Story Continues

A Small, Growing Player

Compared to the big three of Amazon, Microsoft and Alphabet Inc., Oracle is a small player in cloud computing. It has a less than 5% share in the infrastructure-as-a-service market, compared with Amazon Web Services at more than 40% and Microsoft around 16%, according to Bloomberg Intelligence — which also estimated the venture could help grow its cloud infrastructure sales from a roughly $10 billion annual run rate currently to $30 billion or $40 billion over the coming years.

“This moves Oracle even closer to the ballpark that Amazon, Microsoft and Alphabet are mentioned in,” said Jim Awad, senior managing director at Clearstead Advisors, referring to the venture. “While there’s probably some hype around Trump’s announcement, this is still a clear positive. It is in such a powerful long-term uptrend that you need to stay involved, even if valuations aren’t exactly cheap anymore.”

While Oracle’s most recent results failed to live up to high expectations, Wall Street has steadily grown more positive on its prospects, and growth in Oracle’s cloud infrastructure business is expected to far outpace its overall revenue growth this year, according to Bloomberg Consensus estimates.

Still, the stock’s rally on the venture news hasn’t been met with a commensurate increase in the analyst consensus. Expectations for the company’s net 2025 and 2026 earnings are up just 0.2% over the past week, while the view for revenue is unchanged.

The stock’s forward earnings multiple has swelled above 27, well above its 10-year average of 15.8. It also trades at a premium to the Nasdaq 100 Index, though it is below Microsoft’s multiple of 31.

Joe Tigay, portfolio manager of the Rational Equity Armor Fund, is among those taking a cautious eye toward the stock’s rally.

“It’s prudent to wait and see what the actual earnings are and what the actual company says about all these projects, rather than just pricing it in right now because the timing is often uncertain and how big of an impact is always uncertain.”

He added that it was impossible to assess the the prospect of a deal surrounding TikTok without further details.

“In terms of value for Oracle, it’s really hard for me to say that would be great for the bottom line or terrible.”

Tech Chart of the Day

Apple Inc. has slumped almost 11% in January putting the stock on track for its biggest one-month decline since December 2022. Earlier this week, at least two analysts from Loop Capital and Jefferies downgraded their ratings on the stock as weak iPhone sales are becoming an increasing concern for investors. The stock is down about 14% from a December peak.

Top Tech Stories

SK Hynix Inc.’s shares slid after record quarterly results failed to impress investors grappling with stagnant smartphone demand and questions about AI spending in 2025. Elon Musk openly questioned whether companies that joined President Donald Trump’s announcement promising hundreds of billions of dollars in artificial intelligence infrastructure could follow through on their promises, exposing an early internal rift within the White House. President Trump downplayed the national security risk posed by TikTok in an interview with Fox News on Wednesday, days after offering the social video app a reprieve from legislation that would have forced it to shut down. India is trying to pry open the doors of the world’s biggest app stores, setting up a likely clash with Apple Inc. and Alphabet Inc. over social services, safety standards and access to the country’s smartphones. An Indian appeals court temporarily halted an antitrust ruling that fined WhatsApp and prohibited the messenger from sharing user data with other firms and products owned by parent Meta Platforms Inc. Samsung Electronics Co. plans to launch an ultrathin version of its Galaxy S25 phone in the first half of this year, beating Apple Inc. to a promising new category.

Earnings Due Thursday

Premarket

OSI Systems Postmarket

Texas Instruments

--With assistance from Carmen Reinicke and Subrat Patnaik.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news from Greenlight Capital indicates a cautious outlook on the overall market, with concerns about high valuations and disappointing data regarding Apple. Despite Apple being a popular stock among hedge funds, the sentiment expressed suggests that investors may be shifting focus towards AI stocks, which could detract from Apple's appeal. The recent negative return of -13.59% over the past month further supports the likelihood of continued downward pressure on the stock. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a higher chance of the stock price falling compared to rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple is facing a UK probe into its mobile ecosystems and operating systems. Regulatory scrutiny often creates uncertainty and can lead to potential fines or changes in business practices, which investors typically view negatively. While the full impact is unknown without access to the full article, the initial headline suggests a potential negative impact. The lack of details in the provided excerpt makes a precise probability assessment difficult, but the presence of a regulatory probe generally leans towards a negative outlook in the short term. The fact that the article is behind a paywall suggests it contains potentially market-moving information.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline presents a contrasting viewpoint: Zuckerberg's criticism of Apple's innovation versus the article's argument that this shouldn't affect investors.  The article likely provides counterarguments, such as Apple's strong brand loyalty, robust ecosystem, consistent profitability, and potential future innovations that outweigh the perceived lack of recent groundbreaking products.  While Zuckerberg's opinion carries weight, it's unlikely to significantly sway the market on its own.  The market generally reacts to more concrete factors like financial performance, product announcements, and overall economic conditions.  Therefore, the news is likely to have a neutral to slightly positive impact, as the article itself downplays the negative implications of Zuckerberg's statement.  The probability of a price rise is slightly higher due to the article's counter-narrative.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on Oracle Corp.'s advancements in cloud computing and AI, backed by a significant joint venture and political support from President Trump. While this could positively impact Oracle's stock, the analysis for Apple Inc. (AAPL) is derived from a brief mention in the 'Tech Chart of the Day' section, which highlights Apple's recent slump due to weak iPhone sales and analyst downgrades. The negative sentiment around iPhone sales and the stock's recent decline suggest a higher probability of the stock price falling in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses Epic Games' efforts to challenge Apple's and Google's dominance in the mobile app store market by adding third-party game titles to its Epic Games Store. While Epic Games has made some progress, it still faces significant hurdles, including Apple's Core Technology Fee and other restrictions. The dispute has been ongoing since 2020, and a recent court ruling mostly favored Apple. The news is likely to be perceived as a negative for Apple, as it highlights the ongoing challenges to its app store business model. However, given that the dispute is not new and Apple's stock has already priced in some of these risks, the immediate impact on the stock price may be limited. Nevertheless, the persistent challenge to Apple's app store dominance could weigh on investor sentiment.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.57, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.43, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's current stock price decline and analyst expectations for the company's future performance. Despite concerns about iPhone sales and Apple's AI strategy, Wedbush analysts maintain an 'Outperform' rating and $325 price target, citing the potential for Apple's AI strategy to drive growth in the coming years. The article also mentions that the decline in stock price is seen as overdone by Wedbush analysts, which suggests a potential rebound. However, Jefferies analysts have downgraded Apple's rating, citing expectations of weak iPhone sales and limited hardware upgrades. Considering these mixed signals, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is slightly higher than the probability of it falling, as the overall tone of the article suggests that the decline may be temporary and that Apple's long-term prospects remain strong.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple's fiscal first-quarter revenue is expected to be largely in line with market estimates. This suggests no significant positive or negative surprise, which typically results in modest movements in stock prices. Since the news does not present any unexpected developments or strong catalysts for significant change, the probabilities for either rise or fall are relatively balanced but slightly favor a minor increase due to confirmation of expectations.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
}

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news primarily focuses on Oracle Corp.'s advancements in cloud computing and AI, with minimal direct impact on Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, the 'Tech Chart of the Day' section highlights Apple's recent slump of almost 11% in January, driven by weak iPhone sales and analyst downgrades. This negative sentiment, coupled with the lack of positive catalysts for Apple in the news, suggests a higher probability of the stock price continuing to fall in the short term. While Oracle's news is positive for the tech sector overall, it does not provide any immediate relief for Apple's specific challenges.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
```
